required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 13-years Nationwide Study of Alpine Accidents in Austria
clinical_study.official_title: A 13-years Nationwide Retrospective Observational Study of Alpine Accidents in Austria - Sleighing, Skiing, Snowboarding, Snowshoeing, Climbing, Hiking, Cycling, Mountain Biking, Canyoning and Alpine Watersport Activities

brief_summary.textblock:
Brief Summary:
This observational study intends to analyze the characteristic of specific accidents happened in Austrian's mountainous regions. The mechanisms of accidents which are evaluated are accidents while using a sleigh, climbing accidents, cycle accidents, canyoning accidents, hiking accidents, snowshoeing accidents, water-sport accidents, ski and snowboard accidents.

detailed_description.textblock:
The data are collected retrospectively from the database of Austrian alpine police force. These data are analyzed. The information from this database (scene of accident, weather, daytime…) is compared to secondary data collected from the University Hospital of Innsbruck. The comparison of both databases was approved by the Austrian Data Protection Agency. The goal of the study is to give detailed information of circumstances leading to accident and give medical information of the patient's condition and his outcome.
The method to collect data and to analyze is the same than in AN4757 315/4.4 (NCT03405467).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of persons suffered an accident in Alpine Mountains in Austria
primary_outcome.description: The number of persons which suffered one of the specified accidents. (n/year)

primary_outcome.measure: Gender of persons suffered an accident in Alpine Mountains in Austria
primary_outcome.description: Gender male/female or non specified which suffered one of the specified accidents. (n/year)

primary_outcome.measure: Mortality of persons suffered an accident in Alpine Mountains in Austria
primary_outcome.description: Number of persons deceased (deceased/n per year) which suffered one of the specified accidents.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients treated per injury pattern at Medical University of Innsbruck, a major trauma center in western Austria.
secondary_outcome.description: (n/year) treated at Medical University of Innsbruck

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender of patients treated per injury pattern at Medical University of Innsbruck, a major trauma center in western Austria.
secondary_outcome.description: male/female, unspecified treated at Medical University of Innsbruck (n/year)

secondary_outcome.measure: Injury severity score (ISS) per injury pattern at Medical University of Innsbruck, a major trauma center in western Austria.
secondary_outcome.description: Injury severity score of suffered injury (ISS=AIS*AIS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Abbreviated Injury severity scale (AIS) per injury pattern at Medical University of Innsbruck, a major trauma center in western Austria.
secondary_outcome.description: Abbreviated Injury Severity Scale of suffered injury (1-6 points; scale - minor, moderate, serious, severe, critical, maximum)
Type of evacuation (terrestrial, helicopter, combined terrestrial and helicopter) (n/year)
Number of fatalities depending on type of evacuation (n/year)

arm_group.description: Accident occurred while using any form of cycle in the mountains (e.g. bike, mountainbike, e-bike)
Accident occurred while hiking in mountainous area.
Accident occurred while doing any type of Water-sport (e.g. canoeing, kayaking, tubing, swimming) in mountainous environment.
Accident occurred while using ski or a snowboard either in backcountry or on ski slope

study_pop.textblock: All Patients in the two databases eligible for the searched injury patterns.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with the criteria for an alpine accident characteristics described under "Conditions".
Exclusion Criteria:
- All patients without accident characteristics described under "Conditions".
- All patients which suffered an accident not in alpine environment.

overall_official.affiliation: General and Surgical Critical Care Medicine, Medical University of Innsbruck

facility.name: General and Surgical Critical Care Medicine, Medical University of Innsbruck
